metadata.name: Automation Accounts
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Automation Account.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The name of the private endpoint.
Optional. The location to deploy the private endpoint to.
Required. The service (sub-) type to deploy the private endpoint for. For example "vault" or "blob".
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group to create if privateDnsZoneResourceIds were provided.
Optional. The private DNS zone groups to associate the private endpoint with. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Required. Fqdn that resolves to private endpoint ip address.
Required. A list of private ip addresses of the private endpoint.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.
Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. The member name of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. A private ip address obtained from the private endpoint's subnet.
Required. Properties of private endpoint IP configurations.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Optional. Application security groups in which the private endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the private endpoint.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Manual PrivateLink Service Connections.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to 'AllLogs' to collect all logs.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to 'AllMetrics' to collect all metrics.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. The resource ID of a key vault to reference a customer managed key for encryption from.
Required. The name of the customer managed key to use for encryption.
Optional. The version of the customer managed key to reference for encryption. If not provided, using 'latest'.
Optional. User assigned identity to use when fetching the customer managed key. Required if no system assigned identity is available for use.
Required. Name of the Automation Account.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. SKU name of the account.
Optional. The customer managed key definition.
Optional. List of modules to be created in the automation account.
Optional. List of runbooks to be created in the automation account.
Optional. List of schedules to be created in the automation account.
Optional. List of jobSchedules to be created in the automation account.
Optional. List of variables to be created in the automation account.
Optional. ID of the log analytics workspace to be linked to the deployed automation account.
Optional. List of gallerySolutions to be created in the linked log analytics workspace.
Optional. List of softwareUpdateConfigurations to be created in the automation account.
Optional. Whether or not public network access is allowed for this resource. For security reasons it should be disabled. If not specified, it will be disabled by default if private endpoints are set.
Optional. Disable local authentication profile used within the resource.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags of the Automation Account resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]
variables.identity: [if(not(empty(parameters('managedIdentities'))), createObject('type', if(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'systemAssigned'), false()), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'SystemAssigned,UserAssigned', 'SystemAssigned'), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'UserAssigned', null())), 'userAssignedIdentities', if(not(empty(variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'))), variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'), null())), null())]

properties.encryption: [if(not(empty(parameters('customerManagedKey'))), createObject('keySource', 'Microsoft.KeyVault', 'identity', if(not(empty(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'))), createObject('userAssignedIdentity', extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', split(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'), '//'), '/')[2], split(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'), '////'), '/')[4]), 'Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities', last(split(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'), 'dummyMsi'), '/')))), null()), 'keyVaultProperties', createObject('keyName', parameters('customerManagedKey').keyName, 'keyVaultUri', reference('cMKKeyVault').vaultUri, 'keyVersion', if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'keyVersion'), ''))), parameters('customerManagedKey').keyVersion, last(split(reference('cMKKeyVault::cMKKey').keyUriWithVersion, '/'))))), null())]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Automation Account Modules
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Automation Account Module.
Required. Name of the Automation Account module.
Conditional. The name of the parent Automation Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Module package URI, e.g. https://www.powershellgallery.com/api/v2/package.
Optional. Module version or specify latest to get the latest version.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Tags of the Automation Account resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

contentLink.uri: [if(not(equals(parameters('version'), 'latest')), format('{0}/{1}/{2}', parameters('uri'), parameters('name'), parameters('version')), format('{0}/{1}', parameters('uri'), parameters('name')))]

metadata.description: The name of the deployed module.
The resource ID of the deployed module.
The resource group of the deployed module.
The location the resource was deployed into.

metadata.name: Automation Account Schedules
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Automation Account Schedule.
Required. Name of the Automation Account schedule.
Conditional. The name of the parent Automation Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.

metadata.monthDays: Days of the month that the job should execute on. Must be between 1 and 31.
metadata.monthlyOccurrences: Occurrences of days within a month.
metadata.weekDays: Days of the week that the job should execute on.
metadata.description: Optional. The properties of the create Advanced Schedule.
Optional. The description of the schedule.
Optional. The end time of the schedule.
Optional. The frequency of the schedule.
Optional. Anything.
Optional. The start time of the schedule.
Optional. The time zone of the schedule.
Generated. Time used as a basis for e.g. the schedule start date.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the deployed schedule.
The resource ID of the deployed schedule.
The resource group of the deployed schedule.

metadata.name: Automation Account Runbooks
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Automation Account Runbook.
Required. Name of the Automation Account runbook.
Conditional. The name of the parent Automation Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The type of the runbook.
Optional. The description of the runbook.
Optional. The uri of the runbook content.
Optional. The version of the runbook content.
Optional. Resource Id of the runbook storage account.
Generated. Time used as a basis for e.g. the schedule start date.
Optional. SAS token validity length. Usage: 'PT8H' - valid for 8 hours; 'P5D' - valid for 5 days; 'P1Y' - valid for 1 year. When not provided, the SAS token will be valid for 8 hours.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Tags of the Automation Account resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

properties.publishContentLink: [if(not(empty(parameters('uri'))), if(empty(parameters('uri')), null(), createObject('uri', if(not(empty(parameters('uri'))), if(empty(parameters('scriptStorageAccountResourceId')), parameters('uri'), format('{0}?{1}', parameters('uri'), listAccountSas(extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', split(coalesce(parameters('scriptStorageAccountResourceId'), '//'), '/')[2], split(coalesce(parameters('scriptStorageAccountResourceId'), '////'), '/')[4]), 'Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts', last(split(coalesce(parameters('scriptStorageAccountResourceId'), 'dummyVault'), '/'))), '2021-04-01', variables('accountSasProperties')).accountSasToken)), null()), 'version', if(not(empty(parameters('version'))), parameters('version'), null()))), null())]

metadata.description: The name of the deployed runbook.
The resource ID of the deployed runbook.
The resource group of the deployed runbook.
The location the resource was deployed into.

metadata.name: Automation Account Job Schedules
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Automation Account Job Schedule.
Generated. Name of the Automation Account job schedule. Must be a GUID and is autogenerated. No need to provide this value.
Conditional. The name of the parent Automation Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The runbook property associated with the entity.
Required. The schedule property associated with the entity.
Optional. List of job properties.
Optional. The hybrid worker group that the scheduled job should run on.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the deployed job schedule.
The resource ID of the deployed job schedule.
The resource group of the deployed job schedule.

metadata.name: Automation Account Variables
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Automation Account Variable.
Conditional. The name of the parent Automation Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the variable.
Required. The value of the variable. For security best practices, this value is always passed as a secure string as it could contain an encrypted value when the "isEncrypted" property is set to true.
Optional. The description of the variable.
Optional. If the variable should be encrypted. For security reasons encryption of variables should be enabled.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the deployed variable.
The resource ID of the deployed variable.
The resource group of the deployed variable.

metadata.name: Log Analytics Workspace Linked Services
metadata.description: This module deploys a Log Analytics Workspace Linked Service.
Conditional. The name of the parent Log Analytics workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the link.
Required. The resource ID of the resource that will be linked to the workspace. This should be used for linking resources which require read access.
Optional. The resource ID of the resource that will be linked to the workspace. This should be used for linking resources which require write access.
Optional. Tags to configure in the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the deployed linked service.
The resource ID of the deployed linked service.
The resource group where the linked service is deployed.

metadata.name: Operations Management Solutions
metadata.description: This module deploys an Operations Management Solution.
Required. Name of the solution. For Microsoft published gallery solution the target solution resource name will be composed as `{name}({logAnalyticsWorkspaceName})`.
Required. Name of the Log Analytics workspace where the solution will be deployed/enabled.
Optional. Location for all resources.

Optional. The product of the deployed solution. For Microsoft published gallery solution it should be `OMSGallery` and the target solution resource product will be composed as `OMSGallery/{name}`. For third party solution, it can be anything. This is case sensitive.
Optional. The publisher name of the deployed solution. For Microsoft published gallery solution, it is `Microsoft`.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the deployed solution.
The resource ID of the deployed solution.
The resource group where the solution is deployed.
The location the resource was deployed into.

metadata.name: Automation Account Software Update Configurations
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Automation Account Software Update Configuration.
Required. The name of the Deployment schedule.
Conditional. The name of the parent Automation Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The operating system to be configured by the deployment schedule.
Required. Reboot setting for the deployment schedule.
Required. The frequency of the deployment schedule. When using 'Hour', 'Day', 'Week' or 'Month', an interval needs to be provided.
Optional. Maximum time allowed for the deployment schedule to run. Duration needs to be specified using the format PT[n]H[n]M[n]S as per ISO8601.
Optional. Update classification included in the deployment schedule.
Optional. KB numbers or Linux packages excluded in the deployment schedule.
Optional. KB numbers or Linux packages included in the deployment schedule.
Optional. Specify the resources to scope the deployment schedule to.
Optional. Specify tags to which to scope the deployment schedule to.
Optional. Enables the scopeByTags to require All (Tag A and Tag B) or Any (Tag A or Tag B).
Optional. Specify locations to which to scope the deployment schedule to.
Optional. Parameters provided to the task running before the deployment schedule.
Optional. The source of the task running before the deployment schedule.
Optional. Parameters provided to the task running after the deployment schedule.
Optional. The source of the task running after the deployment schedule.
Optional. The interval of the frequency for the deployment schedule. 1 Hour is every hour, 2 Day is every second day, etc.
Optional. Enables the deployment schedule.
Optional. Time zone for the deployment schedule. IANA ID or a Windows Time Zone ID.
Optional. Array of functions from a Log Analytics workspace, used to scope the deployment schedule.
Optional. List of azure resource IDs for azure virtual machines in scope for the deployment schedule.
Optional. List of names of non-azure machines in scope for the deployment schedule.
Optional. Required when used with frequency 'Week'. Specified the day of the week to run the deployment schedule.
Optional. Can be used with frequency 'Month'. Provides the specific days of the month to run the deployment schedule.

Optional. Can be used with frequency 'Month'. Provides the pattern/cadence for running the deployment schedule in a month. Takes objects formed like this {occurance(int),day(string)}. Day is the name of the day to run the deployment schedule, the occurance specifies which occurance of that day to run the deployment schedule.

Optional. The start time of the deployment schedule in ISO 8601 format. To specify a specific time use YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS, 2021-12-31T23:00:00. For schedules where we want to start the deployment as soon as possible, specify the time segment only in 24 hour format, HH:MM, 22:00.
Optional. The end time of the deployment schedule in ISO 8601 format. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS, 2021-12-31T23:00:00.
Optional. The expiry time's offset in minutes.
Optional. The next time the deployment schedule runs in ISO 8601 format. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS, 2021-12-31T23:00:00.
Optional. The next run's offset in minutes.
Optional. The schedules description.

Generated. Do not touch. Is used to provide the base time for time comparison for startTime. If startTime is specified in HH:MM format, baseTime is used to check if the provided startTime has passed, adding one day before setting the deployment schedule.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

updateConfiguration.linux: [if(equals(parameters('operatingSystem'), 'Linux'), createObject('excludedPackageNameMasks', parameters('excludeUpdates'), 'includedPackageNameMasks', parameters('includeUpdates'), 'includedPackageClassifications', variables('updateClassificationsVar'), 'rebootSetting', parameters('rebootSetting')), null())]
updateConfiguration.windows: [if(equals(parameters('operatingSystem'), 'Windows'), createObject('excludedKbNumbers', parameters('excludeUpdates'), 'includedKbNumbers', parameters('includeUpdates'), 'includedUpdateClassifications', variables('updateClassificationsVar'), 'rebootSetting', parameters('rebootSetting')), null())]

metadata.description: The name of the deployed softwareUpdateConfiguration.
The resource ID of the deployed softwareUpdateConfiguration.
The resource group of the deployed softwareUpdateConfiguration.

name.value: [coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'name'), format('pep-{0}-{1}-{2}', last(split(resourceId('Microsoft.Automation/automationAccounts', parameters('name')), '/')), coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'service'), coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()].service), copyIndex()))]

metadata.name: Private Endpoints
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.
Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. The member name of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. A private ip address obtained from the private endpoint's subnet.
Required. Properties of private endpoint IP configurations.
Required. Fqdn that resolves to private endpoint ip address.
Required. A list of private ip addresses of the private endpoint.
Required. Name of the private endpoint resource to create.
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Required. Resource ID of the resource that needs to be connected to the network.
Optional. Application security groups in which the private endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the private endpoint.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Required. Subtype(s) of the connection to be created. The allowed values depend on the type serviceResourceId refers to.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group to create if `privateDnsZoneResourceIds` were provided.
Optional. The private DNS zone groups to associate the private endpoint. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Optional. Manual PrivateLink Service Connections.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Groups
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Group.
Conditional. The name of the parent private endpoint. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Array of private DNS zone resource IDs. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
The name of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource ID of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource group the private endpoint DNS zone group was deployed into.
The resource group the private endpoint was deployed into.
The resource ID of the private endpoint.
The name of the private endpoint.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The name of the deployed automation account.
The resource ID of the deployed automation account.
The resource group of the deployed automation account.
The principal ID of the system assigned identity.
The location the resource was deployed into.
